website_summaries.verdict: Powerful gas chainsaw with good torque and solid name-brand performance. A little overpriced compared to some, but great for felling large trees.
pros: A brute of a model in sizes from 18 to 24 inches, the 460 Rancher packs a 60cc powerhouse engine
Starts dependably and features low-vibration technology to minimize arm fatigue when you're tackling big jobs
cons: This heavy-duty model may be a little too much saw for a typical household's needs

website_summaries.verdict: The 20-inch blade is just the right size for most chainsawing jobs. The starting process may be challenging to some but reliable for most.
pros: The shorter blade is easier to control
cons: Chain brake has some design issues

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE THIS VENDOR
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item. When it came, it was DEFECTIVE and couldn't even be put together by a chain saw mechanic, which I paid for his time out of my pocket. When I tried to return the DEFECTIVE item, I was told I couldn't return it. This is absolutely ridiculous. I will publicize broadly NOT to use this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Cushman

customer_reviews.title: real upgrade on poulan pro 42cc
customer_reviews.text: Big storm with several trees and lots of limbs down was finally too much of a challenge for my Poulan. Got this because I couldn't justify the expense of a pro saw for occasional cleanup and firewood cutting. It's a very definite step up. Much more power, goes right through trunks the old saw had to be babied on even with a sharp blade. Cut a 30" sweet gum off its root ball with ease, just let the saw do the work and dropped it right through. Wouldn't have even tried that before. Did have some trouble starting it at first, but once I dumped out my stale old fuel and put in fresh it's kicked right up.
customer_reviews.author: CarlD

customer_reviews.title: got an open box item
customer_reviews.text: Received item that appears new but box was obviously opened before. Box had been relabeled twice like item was return in the past. Box was missing quick start sheets and fuel/oil bottle that comes with unopened item. I haven't assembled item yet so I do not know if it works but I will notifying Amazon on questionable used product sold as brand new item without discount or notice to customer.
customer_reviews.author: vancomycin_man

customer_reviews.title: Lasted thirty minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Was buying this to replace my Stihl the saw lasted about 30 minutes and then froze up would not restart seems similar to what other people have been having problems with thank goodness for Amazon they came through and took care of me
customer_reviews.author: Paul Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Trigger not connected to Carb
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd saw from husqvarna. I have been very happy with my saws. I'm writing this because when I received it the trigger was disconnected from the carburetor. Started it and pulled the trigger and the trigger jammed and no throttle increase. It wasn't a problem fixing it since I know my way around a saw but it shouldn't have come this way. Unrelated I bought a splitter a few years ago and the choke was installed backwards. What the hell!
customer_reviews.author: Randall L. Bettis

customer_reviews.title: Faulty throttle
customer_reviews.text: After extended “chats” with India, where I got no results, I called Amazon. As they have always done, they rectified the situation immediately. I very rarely have a problem with Amazon, but in future, no more chats. There was no resolution for me there, but one call to the U.S. based customer service and all was made right. Thank you, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Miss El

customer_reviews.title: Great chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Awesome chain saw! Had to purchase a real chainsaw after Hurricane Michael wiped out our town. My 16” saw just couldn’t cut it! This saw made quick work of clearing our yard of 9 pine trees and 3 oaks. Been using it to help others out and this Husky works flawlessly and starts every 1st or 2nd pull. Have had no issues whatsoever except going through chains due to the amount of trees we have had to cut. I use the premix fuel sold in hardware stores, no ethanol for me! Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend buying
customer_reviews.text: Spark plug blew out of the piston in less than 15 hrs of use. Used for large locusts and hedge trees. It is not covered under their warranty due to tiny detail writing in their “2 yr warranty.” This is my third husqvarna saw. The others are smaller models and 10&14 years old. I’m not sure if it is the size or new model but it broke with factory parts within a year. Also bought the extended warranty on amazon. Wouldn’t recommend buying either.
customer_reviews.author: George Bachman

customer_reviews.title: A little trouble starting
customer_reviews.text: The saw was a great price but would not start immediately. After quite a few cranks, I pulled the cover and removed the plug to check. It was firing properly, the primer bulb was full but no gas to the carburetor. I pulled the air filter and poured a very small amount directly into the carb, one pull and fire up. Turned off and restarted several times with no hesitation. Hope this helps someone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for serious cutting
customer_reviews.text: Best of 4 chainsaws I have owned and used for years. All were good but this Huskquavna is tops in all comparisons! I use the saw and past saws routinely for 40 plus years. Top as in "Excellent!" Stars well, usually on 2nd pull as long as the proper starting method is used. I would rate this one as the No #1 of saws.
customer_reviews.author: HossJL

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw! Cuts like a champ and starts up every time. It's easy to maintain and is a workhorse on my property. Vibration is so low on this saw, it's comfortable to cut for long periods of time. It is well balanced and lightweight for a 60cc saw. Be sure you use ethanol free 50:1 fuel oil mixture only. I also use the Husqvarna bar & chain oil and I like it a lot. The only drawback is the included chain. Get yourself a full skip chain and lose the safety chain Husqvarna provides. You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ames

customer_reviews.title: This is a great saw!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace an older chainsaw, for which parts are becoming increasingly difficult to find. I chose the Husqvarna 460 on the basis of the larger engine displacement, the capacity to handle a 24" bar if I wanted to add that later, and numerous good reviews. It has not disappointed at all. It has sufficient power for work around the property and in the woods, it is lighter than the saw (Poulan 3450) it replaced, I love the ease of starting it, the balance of the saw while operating it. Well worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious machine. If you know what you are doing and take the time to read the manual and make adjustments then this chainsaw will not let you down. Take care of your equipment and it will take care of you. Out of the box there's going to be a break in period for both the saw and chain so make sure to adjust the carburetor and tighten the chain as needed. It's a lot of saw so if you aren't used to running one all day make sure to take frequent breaks as it can get heavy.
customer_reviews.author: phillip blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Powerful saw, a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my son. Compared with my older Ranger 18" this Husky is way better. Much more power, Easy starting, and slices up firewood like a lumberjack. Pay heed to other reviewers' comments about the odd design of the automatic chain safety lock, if you open the case without first taking the proper steps you may need to buy a special tool to unlock it.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Got it to chop up a large oak tree that came down in the last storm. A lot of work, but this chainsaw made all the cutting easy work -- moving the stuff is a different story though. 20" is a good bar size for this model. I'm not sure if would have enough power for larger cuts where you would want a 24" bar -- but maybe you can do it with a bit of patience.
customer_reviews.author: Ed H

customer_reviews.title: Received incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Update: husqvarna said they would send a tensioner and just needed my receipt, which I sent. They never responded. I purchased one online and the saw works great, I've been happy with it. Very disappointed in the service. And I couldn't find any service center around me, in metro Detroit, that had one, so I had to wait for it to be delivered. Looks good, except that it was delivered without a chain tensioner, so it's useless. Husqvarna is closed until monday, and I can't find the part locally. Not happy. Saw looks brand new by the way, just an error at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Van Hooser

customer_reviews.title: Brake dragging
customer_reviews.text: I have less than 2 hours on the saw and already having issues. Looks like the brake is dragging. Creating heat and allowing the chain to come loose. The saw has great reviews so maybe I got a lemon. I have ordered a replacement clutch cover to see if that will fix it. Disappointed to have an issue with an expensive saw so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: LaxCoach

customer_reviews.title: Good machine but labeling error
customer_reviews.text: I put this through its paces as soon as I got it. I've been cutting through wood like a hot knife through butter. My only issue so far is I can't find a customer service number to contact Husqvarna directly. My 460 Rancher has a serial number plate that says 460 but the sticker on the side says 455 so I wonder which I have but I can't get anyone to answer my question.
customer_reviews.author: StephenC

customer_reviews.title: Frequent problems with gas line and chain oil case leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for infrequent use. Unfortunately problem didn't arise until one month out of warranty. Web search shows these are frequent problems. I thought this was supposed to be a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful saw. Easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful saw. Easy to handle. Made *really* short work of a fallen tree which got caught atop a tall fence. Some tricky cuts were required to maintain safety and to get the tree off the fence with a minimum of damage. The 460 Rancher was totally up to the task and worked well from numerous angles-- even single handed for one partial cut. Very mild kickback for such a powerful saw, but the chain it came with was kind of conservative, to better protect the inexperienced.
customer_reviews.author: T1PSTN

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: Cuts better than any chainsaw I've ever used. A friend of mine with a 440 keeps borrowing mine and repeated offers to buy it from me. It's a great balance of power and bar size at 20". Keep it sharp and it will cut through anything.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas F.

customer_reviews.title: Saw. Awesome.. Chain? Not so much!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok... Yes.. It's been years.. I used to live by the saw, firewood, logging, tree topper.. That being said.. I have never thrown as many chains as this saw has. Had to buy a new chain, as the provided chain bent!!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Milner

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn't tighten well and the chain jumps off easily and goes back on hard
customer_reviews.text: Prior models of this brand had the screw to tighten the chain in a different location. Not sure if the move was for safety or what but it STINKS! Investigating now if all newer chainsaws are this way and I need to suffer or if I can return for a different model that doesn't suck . . . .
customer_reviews.author: CTS65

customer_reviews.title: great saw check bar for warp
customer_reviews.text: great saw. cuts and feals great. saw ran perfect right out of the box. The bar comes unattached. Look at it carefully before installing, mine was warped. sight it for bends, bananas, warps. Amazon sent me a new one no questions asked. thats why they are the best! the new bar is not warped at all
customer_reviews.author: Boat

customer_reviews.title: My second husky
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was superfast. I didn't expect it until Monday and Saturday the box was sitting on my porch. Fired up right out of the box without any issues. Took down a few dead trees and bucked them into hunks in minutes. This is my second husky, first one lasted more years than I can count and I am hoping for similar with this one.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect Bar Listed, Otherwise Great Saw with Plenty of Torque
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as having a .050" bar, but it came with a .058" bar instead. I had to pay return shipping to return the .050" chain that I had purchased separately and order a more expensive and less common .058" chain. If you run the model number (966048330) on the Husqvarna website, it shows a .058" bar. Not a Husqvarna issue, just a listing issue. ****Otherwise, the saw itself is fantastic.**** (Husqvarna 460 with 20" bar.) Plenty of torque for bucking large diameter trees.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 460 lives up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: So far this Husqvarna 460 has performed quite well. It is very similar to my old Husq 350 (which I still love) so the learning curve was minimal. The extra power and 20" bar make it a good choice for the big oaks I had to cut into firewood. Although I like my 350 for limbing I cannot complain about the power to weight ratio on the 460. It does use more fuel than the 350 but that can be expected due to having much more power.
customer_reviews.author: Diogenes

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: The saw ran good until warm figured out it was a defective coil bought a new one finally runs great now, would be pleased if I got a promotional item for the frustration, but otherwise good saw.
customer_reviews.author: jim pirtle

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Husqvarna over a Stihl
customer_reviews.text: I did countless hours of research for on chainsaws for our property, and after all the reviews ended up purchasing the Husqvarna 460 Rancher and will never look back. Don’t waste your time with a temperamental Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: StefanieTyler

customer_reviews.title: Beware ! You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The price for the saw seemed good. Have had Jonsered for over 40 years. Wanted something where parts and service was much easier to find. This saw has no where near the cutting power you would expect. Had a problem and repair bill for chain brake within first 25 hours of operation. When it is under heavy load for a sustained period, will cut out and not restart immediately. Wish I could return this and add $300 and buy a better saw. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: pamela kirch

customer_reviews.title: Top grade saw
customer_reviews.text: Fired up after a few pulls, took a minute to warm up, and performed well. Only cut for a few minutes so far, but if it holds up anywhere near my old 350 I’ll happily give it 5stars.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: Really good saw. May need adjustment on delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Really good machine. Cuts so much better than my old one. One star down because I had to adjust the idle speed, else it would stop and be hard to start if I had to set it down for a moment . Manual says it was adjusted a at factory for minimum emissions, maybe that is the issue.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw, be sure to have the right chain size
customer_reviews.text: Nice saw. The chain that came with it was the wrong size - too big. Fortunately we bought an extra 3/8, 72 links by 0.5 gauge that worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: The best to use but make sure you read instructions
customer_reviews.text: It’s Husqvarna, the quality is good, runs wonderful but if you never used one make sure you read the instructions otherwise you rush damaging the safety features.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Husky to the max
customer_reviews.text: This saw is so far advanced beyond the 1998 55 rancher I have been using for years. It's so easy to start and doesn't really weigh much more than my old saw. I love how the exhaust is blowing away from all plastic areas unlike my old one and the ant vibe system really does make a difference in operator fatigue.LOTS of power and reasonable price for what you get. I use it mostly for sawing logs into lumber without the use of any attachments. Not easy but it's a lot cheaper than a sawmill.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He is 81 years old and still cutting firewood. He has always liked husqvarna products. He is very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Woodi

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw !!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 445 Husky saw and recently a few large trees fell on my pond. Bought the Husqvarna 460 for a great price, New on Amazon along with a case. Took about 1 hour to cut up and clear my path. The trees were both about 20" in diameter on the parts I cut in the pics. Still some to go but this saw cut like butter. Great Saw will last a long time if its like my 445.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Remove shipping washers
customer_reviews.text: Needs better assembly instructions when attaching the bar, there are two plastic washers that have to be removed
customer_reviews.author: G. Zenanko

customer_reviews.title: Grandmother
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect chainsaw for a tree that fell in our backyard. We were able to cut it up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lisbeth Harris

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great saw however the engine has more power than the clutch so don't force. Otherwise nice saw👌
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Frequently temperamental and difficult to start. Runs well when ...
customer_reviews.text: Frequently temperamental and difficult to start. Runs well when it does run but very difficult to start at least half of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Scagnetti

customer_reviews.title: Received different bar and chain guage.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in good shape and no major issues. The one problem I have is that I paid more for the 20" bar with .050 chain. I received the 20" with .058 chain. What bothers me is that there is a price difference, costing more for the .050 guage links. I don't like the fact I paid more for an item I didn't receive. Great chainsaw, just Amazon didn't deliver what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Aukee J.

customer_reviews.title: husband loves
customer_reviews.text: my husband chops and deliver wood for a side job and he loves this..
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Mould

customer_reviews.title: Piece of shit wont even start, guess they dont make them like they used to.
customer_reviews.text: My old as the hills husky in the foreground starts fine even though I have to tinker with it a fair amount occasionally. I will be returning the new worthless one.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: IT IS JUNK !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Bought for my husband 6 months ago. It’s been in the box. Just opened it today !!!! It won’t crank ! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. IT IS JUNK !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Not quite professional, but damn close! When used with a chain this thing can do some serious damage, and trees will fear the sound fo you coming. Without the chain its great for home decor, or walk into the local hardware store and ask them why it wont cut anything. Can also be used for halloween events or waking the kids up out of bed for school (just kidding).
customer_reviews.author: DogLovingFool

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw!
customer_reviews.text: Wife got this for me. Plenty of power for around the property. Remember to disengage the brake before trying to remove side cover plate, otherwise you're going to have a hell of a time getting it back on. I had to fab a tool to disengage the brake while the cover was off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a great saw!
customer_reviews.text: At first use, had hard time getting the side plate back on. Went to YouTube and Huskvarna showed me axactly how to take care of it. It is a great saw !!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon H. Pace

customer_reviews.title: Good saw!
customer_reviews.text: My son lives in the mountains of SW Montana and uses wood as his primary fuel for heating his home. When his chainsaw broke down (pull cord broke) Like a good father, I had this saw sent out to him from Amazon. He was delighted with the ease with which this saw cuts firewood compared to his old saw. He tells me that it cuts with far more power (torque?) than his old saw and never slows during a cut. He is very pleased with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: AGB

customer_reviews.title: Power
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw so much power and so smooth. Ive always has Still saws. Finally treated myself to a Husqvarna and am very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: ChadlyNCo

customer_reviews.title: Best Chain Saw ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best chain saw I have ever had. Love this and highly recommend this make and model. Starts every time quickly and runs, cuts, & idles very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I researched a long time & decided this is exactly what my husband needed. It’s a Who’s Your Daddy Chainsaw & something I knew my husband would never buy for himself. He absolutely LOVES It! He uses it to cut down dead oak trees so super hard wood & this things cuts like a hot knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Tynes

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Great Chainsaw, easy to use, started right up. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL MATHIS

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Having wooded acreage to maintain a good saw is a must. After unpacking, reading the instructions and filling with fluids, the saw cranked on the first pull. It cut through several sweet gums like butter an I was very pleased. My old saw was 14 years old and endured several fuel line, bar, sproket and chain replacements. It is still a good saw but under powered. This 460 has the power and time will tell if it lasts as long as the wild thing.
customer_reviews.author: DEFREEZER

customer_reviews.title: Great saw. I have cut 6 cords worth of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. I have cut 6 cords worth of wood with it so far without any major issue. I would recommend using Ethanol Fuel Treatment & Stabilizer with this chainsaw. Also avoid servicing with the brake on as it will be a pain to unlock the brake to get the cover back on.
customer_reviews.author: mito

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice saw. Always starts right up. New chains are fair priced. Cuts like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Don Becker

customer_reviews.title: Rancher saw is #1
customer_reviews.text: Awesome saw for a great price. Nice OEM chain, arrived tuned and adjusted even for altitude.
customer_reviews.author: Josh J.

customer_reviews.title: Best chainsaw I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I went through 2 chainsaws in a year before purchasing this one, and now I have been using it for 4 years wiht no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cronin

customer_reviews.title: Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my husband after much research. We burn wood for heat all winter long. Cuts fast and easy. Bigger than his old chainsaw. Wants to kick a little bit and you definitely need safety glasses as the chainsaw throw chips up at your face. He seems to like it though and uses it a couple of times a week. Wish is wasn't quite so heavy. Very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Very bad buy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure this was not a real Husqvarna first time I tried using it started smoking really bad and the interior started melting
customer_reviews.author: Federico Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Reliably cutting at altitude
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and torque-e compared to same engine size Stihl. I use this at 7,000ft elevation and it runs while my Stihl cuts out.
customer_reviews.author: HungryHippo

customer_reviews.title: Oilin' monster oak slayer!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome saw that oils fast enough to cut dry oak for several hours without ever heating up the chain!
customer_reviews.author: Hipstr62

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as xmas presentto replace old chainsaw. Needless to say it cuts like butter, everyone in the family wants to use it. easy to operate, uses little to no gas, look no farther. This was used to help clear a large tree grove that hadnt been touched in years. after a full day of work i would not want any other saw ever and have been using it since with no problems. I will love husqvarna forever.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Chavis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw
customer_reviews.text: Thats it. Just an awesome saw. More than enough power, makes short work of large tasks, built well, and seems very sturdy. The only complaint I would have is that it leaks bar oil while being stored. They do recommend you drain it after each use, but why can't they do something to remedy the problem?? I have a $60 chain saw that doesnt leak while sitting, why does my $460 saw???
customer_reviews.author: Ronrizz

customer_reviews.title: One hour of use and has to go for warranty repair
customer_reviews.text: Received it 5 days ago, used it for one hour, on/off switch does not function. Only way to turn it off it to choke it fully and wait. Doesn't say much for the longterm usage of this nearly $500 chainsaw that it has to immediately get warranty repair to make it work as it should when new.
customer_reviews.author: jdinariz

customer_reviews.title: Started easy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time complete and the bar and chain was easy to assemble. The saw Was easy to start using the compression button. It seems to have plenty of power. Good buy and service
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Stick with Stihl. This chainsaw is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty chain saw, but chain has never fit correctly. Not easy to assemble. Had to spend $60 more to repair the tension brake and get a new chain. Will never buy Husqvarna chain saw again. Should've stuck with Stihl in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hartter

customer_reviews.title: This was good chouse of mine to buy this one vs
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and reliable. I’m using one already second year. This was good chouse of mine to buy this one vs. it competitor that is 1.5x expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Serge A.

customer_reviews.title: Best saw I ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he loves it. It is a professional grade saw.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw! I have always been a Stihl fan but my longtime dealer didn't want to keep my business. I found this saw on Amazon for a great price. Got it in, put the bar and chain on, filled it up and it started on the second pull. Light enough to handle easily but has plenty of power to do everything I need to do around the farm. If you do trip the chain brake while the cover is off, just reset it with an open end wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Ol'Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I work with the professional version at work all day. Just as good!
customer_reviews.author: christopher l

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: This saw does everything I need it to do and then some! Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Norseman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is everything I expected. It's powerful yet feels smooth in your hands. It's a bit heavy, but it is a big saw and built with quality in mind. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg E. Foust

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw
customer_reviews.text: Item showed up with a damaged box and cracked air filter cover. Amazon immediately made it right. I did a lot of searching before I bought this saw and I can honestly say it’s most definitely your best bang for your buck. Saw cuts amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A solid bargain.
customer_reviews.text: If you need a rugged, heavy duty saw but you are not a full time professional tree cutter this model will fit your needs. It has all the power you will ever need to cut through any type of wood up to about 3 feet in diameter. And it costs about half of what a pro model would. It seems well balanced for a 20 inch saw and has a compression release to make it easy to start, especially for old timers like me. I have used it for one season so far to cut about 60 cords of hardwood with no problems. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bob23

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. It does the job and is very easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Mc Donald

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it and it works great. It is def. a workhorse. Not for the ladies. It is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power.
customer_reviews.text: This saw works just like the old fashioned hard working saws. Wish I had bought this a long time ago. Love my Stihl for trim work but this saw really cuts when I get into harder wood.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Best saw I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: Great step up from my smaller saws, this saw has the power to get the job done without beating you up to bad.. yes it's a little on the heavy side but once ur in the wood you will appreciate it
customer_reviews.author: chad b.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, really happy i went with this and not something cheaper (made)
customer_reviews.text: this thing is great, i have had it for about a year and a half. very powerful and well built. easy to work on. for the true serious home owner you cant beat this thing, and even if you have a large farm or ranch this thing will get the job done and then some.
customer_reviews.author: nickB

customer_reviews.title: was an easy fix. I love it and would tell anyone ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 3 yrs ago and it still cranks on the first couple of pulls. Only problem I've had out of it is the fuel line broke inside the tank which isn't a big deal, was an easy fix. I love it and would tell anyone looking for a chainsaw to buy a Husqvarna.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: GOT WRONG BAR AND CHAIN WITH MY NEW SAW.
customer_reviews.text: I CAN NOT RETURN IT.PAYED OVER 500.00 FOR IT NOW I HAVE TO BUY A 100.00 BAR AND CHAIN TO USE IT. DO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: larry gaca

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems
customer_reviews.text: Have had nothing but problems with this saw since day one. It has leaked bar oil since 1st fill up. It also has a major idle problem that I can't seem to solve. I really regret purchasing this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: So far so great! 45 cords of firewood and still chugging along like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Hard to stop
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this saw. It's very hard to start and it dies every time you take your hand off the trigger. I'm ready to send it back. I don't understand, it's supposed to be a good saw
customer_reviews.author: Peter Estep

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, doesnt work properly
customer_reviews.text: Came defective. Terribly difficult to start and wont stay running. Since its past the return Amazon wont do anything about it. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well against those damn teenagers at the camp. To be fair, they were warned it was haunted.
customer_reviews.author: clint mills

customer_reviews.title: New WiFi barless chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this saw a few days ago, just arrived today. Opened the box to find everything but the bar. Can't do much without a bar.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Cuts the 20 inch logs I'm working with easily. I'm happy with this purchase and would recommend ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Cuts the 20 inch logs I'm working with easily. I'm happy with this purchase and would recommend this brand of chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: V. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna poor chainsaw review
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this item is quite poor. I could not even put the chain onto the saw because the spring which goes around the gear box was too tight so could not go back on.
customer_reviews.author: Gola

customer_reviews.title: The saw starts and runs good, its a good value
customer_reviews.text: The saw starts and runs good, its a good value. The only down side, is it leaks bar oil. I recently stepped up to a Stihl 441, and it was sure worth it. Much better saw, doesn't leak a drop of bar oil.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kersey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, plenty of power. One of the Best saw I have owned. Very happy so far
customer_reviews.author: Odie2017

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Should cut better for the money. Saw bogs down after cutting for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Simon

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna makes the best chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw! Cutting and trimming my tree's has never been easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you would expect from Husqvarna
customer_reviews.text: This saw works excellent. Cut down 6 large Oak trees today. Ran and cut like a champ. Note I do not like the H80 chains most saws come with so I purchased an H47 as I always do. Started with 1 or 2 pulls every time. Great powerful saw.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Glidden

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna
customer_reviews.text: Only had the saw a few days but started up first pull. Easy to run, easy to use, lots of power. Great saw
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: the bomb!
customer_reviews.text: can I just say this saw is worth the extra money. the bomb!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this for cutting down trees and cutting fire wood. Very well made and easy to use. It's actually more compact than my electric chain-saw and about the same weight. It should last for many years if it's well maintained.
customer_reviews.author: DBCooper

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: No problems with this saw. Makes short work of large pine logs. Great value for the money. Handles the 20 inch chain with ease.
customer_reviews.author: HDM

customer_reviews.title: Good weight, good power
customer_reviews.text: Impressed so far but have just cut one tree. Started with ease. Easy to setup. MUCH better than my 18 inch Poulan which doesn't have much power, constantly stalled and the gas cap didn't work any more. Very happy thus far.
customer_reviews.author: jt

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 20 Inch 460 Rancher Gas Chainsaw
product_meta.description: Size:20 in. - .058 in. GaugeThe ergonomic design of the Husqvarna 20 inch 460 Rancher gas chainsaw allows the homeowner to handle the power of the saw with ease. Powerful, yet easy to start thanks to SmartStart technology, this gas powered chainsaw is ready to cut trees, whether you need to prune, limb or cut firewood. The air injection centrifugal air cleaning system helps keep larger dust and debris particles from reaching the air filter, to improve engine life. The LowVib anti-vibration system reduces vibration levels, for more comfortable chainsaw operation.
feature_bullets: 460 Rancher chainsaw is a robust all-round saw for jobs that need a longer Bar
60. 3cc 20 inch gas chainsaw with guide bar and chain, Torque, max. 3.4 Nm
2 cycle engine with intertia activated chain brake for safety while operating
Orange Husqvarna chainsaw Bar cover and 2. 6 ounce 2 cycle fuel Included, Bar and chain oil must be purchased Separately
Automatic chain oiler delivers a steady supply of bar and chain oil for safe and effective use.Maximum power speed: 9000 rpm
Simple, side-mounted chain tensioning system allows for quick chain adjustments while working
The quick-release air filter facilitates easy cleaning and replacement of the air filter
Husqvarna chainsaw with x-torque lowers fuel consumption and reduces emissions
For safety use with Husqvarna chainsaw chaps, chainsaw gloves and chainsaw helmet

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
